Q: My wife has esr count of 65.recently a small lump of 17 mm detected in one breast.FNAC has been advised and to be done shortly.she has hypothyroid problem forlast several years and takes 50 mg medicine every day.is high esr due to possible breast cancer?
A: Hi, dairy have gone through your question. I can understand your concern. There are many causes of high ESR. Anemia, infection, inflammation, tuberculosis, autoimmune disease, paraproteinemia, malignancy all can lead to high ESR. If your wife has breast lump then she has chances of breast cancer. She should go for mammography and fine needle aspiration cytology or biopsy. It will give you exact diagnosis. Then she should take treatment accordingly. Continue her Chat Doctor.
